item.title: 欧盟称已拒绝中国电动汽车出口商提出的最低价格建议
item.description: 欧盟委员会周四表示，已收到中国电动汽车制造商关于欧盟最低进口价格的提议，但已全部拒绝。【原文：The European Commission said on Thursday it had received offers from electric vehicle makers in China for minimum import prices into the European Union, but had rejected all of them.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织称，随着经济放缓，美国联邦储备委员会宜启动宽松周期
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）周四表示，由于通胀上行风险已经减弱，美国联邦储备委员会（U.S. Federal Reserve）在下周的会议上开始期待已久的货币宽松周期是合适的。【原文：The International Monetary Fund said on Thursday it was appropriate for the U.S. Federal Reserve to begin a long-awaited monetary easing cycle at its meeting next week as upside risks to inflation have subsided.】

item.title: 消息人士称，由于客户改变策略，拉扎德报告 8 月份资金外流 75 亿美元
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的人士周四告诉路透社，拉扎德资产管理公司的一位客户转而采用被动投资策略后，该公司的资产管理业务在 8 月份出现了 75 亿美元的净流出。【原文：Lazard's asset management business saw net outflows of $7.5 billion in August after one of its clients switched to a passive investing strategy, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 加拿大航空公司称政府应做好准备防止飞行员罢工
item.description: 加拿大航空公司周四表示，加拿大联邦政府应准备好进行干预，以防止最早可能于下周开始的飞行员罢工。【原文：Air Canada said on Thursday that the federal Canadian government should be prepared to intervene to prevent a pilots' strike that could begin as early as next week.】

item.title: Atlas Partners 将投资 Carlyle 旗下的 Sedgwick 公司
item.description: 私募股权公司 Carlyle Group 旗下的 Sedgwick 周四宣布获得 Atlas Partners 的战略投资，这意味着企业总价值将达到 132 亿美元。【原文：Private equity firm Carlyle Group-owned Sedgwick on Thursday announced a strategic investment from Atlas Partners that will imply a total enterprise value of $13.2 billion.】

item.title: 标普全球评级公司称长期工人罢工可能损害波音公司评级
item.description: S&P 全球评级公司（S&P Global Ratings）周四表示，如果波音公司面临长期的工人罢工，可能会推迟这家飞机制造商的复苏，并损害其整体评级。【原文：S&P Global Ratings said on Thursday if Boeing faces an extended worker strike, it could delay the planemaker's recovery and hurt its overall rating.】

item.title: 全球降息周期步伐加快
item.description: 主要央行的降息行动正在有条不紊地进行，欧洲中央银行（European Central Bank）周四宣布今年第二次降息四分之一个百分点。【原文：Interest rate cuts from major central banks are well underway, with the European Central Bank on Thursday delivering its second quarter-point cut of the year.】

item.title: eToro 与美国证券交易委员会达成和解，将关闭几乎所有加密货币交易
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）周四表示，作为与该委员会达成的和解协议的一部分，零售交易平台 eToro 将停止向其客户提供几乎所有加密货币。【原文：Retail trading platform eToro will stop offering nearly all cryptocurrencies to its customers as part of a settlement with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, the regulator said Thursday.】

item.title: 美国 8 月生产者价格涨幅略高于预期
item.description: 由于服务成本上升，8 月份美国生产者价格涨幅略高于预期，但趋势仍与通胀消退一致。【原文：U.S. producer prices increased slightly more than expected in August amid higher costs for services, but the trend remained consistent with subsiding inflation.】

item.title: 达美航空受 CrowdStrike 故障影响下调收入预期
item.description: 达美航空公司（Delta Air Lines）周四下调了第三季度收入预期，原因是 7 月份的全球网络故障导致航班取消和业务中断。【原文：Delta Air Lines cut its third-quarter revenue forecast on Thursday following the flight cancellations and business disruptions caused by a global cyber outage in July.】

item.title: 亚马逊市场负责人表示，亚马逊将长期在南非发展
item.description: 美国电子商务巨头亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）在四个月前首次进军撒哈拉以南非洲地区后，其地区市场负责人周四表示，亚马逊公司将在南非长期发展。【原文：U.S. e-commerce giant Amazon.com is in South Africa for the long run, its regional marketplace head said on Thursday, after its first foray into Sub-Saharan Africa four months ago.】

item.title: 爱立信与多家运营商合作开发网络 API
item.description: 瑞典电信设备制造商爱立信公司周四发表声明称，该公司已成立一家新的合资企业，与各地十多家电信运营商合作销售网络软件工具。【原文：Swedish telecom equipment maker Ericsson has created a new joint venture for selling network software tools with over a dozen telecom operators across regions, it said in a statement on Thursday.】

item.title: 麦当劳在美国大多数分店将 5 美元套餐优惠延长至 12 月
item.description: 麦当劳连锁汉堡店周四表示，该店将其在美国大多数分店提供的 5 美元超值套餐延长至 12 月。【原文：McDonald's extended its $5 value meal offer into December at most of its U.S. locations, the burger chain said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国禁止 Navient 提供联邦学生贷款服务，命令其支付 1.2 亿美元
item.description: 美国监管机构周四表示，将禁止 Navient 公司为联邦学生贷款提供服务，并勒令该公司为广泛的学生贷款失误支付 1.2 亿美元。【原文：A U.S. regulator on Thursday said it is banning Navient from servicing federal student loans, and ordered the company to pay $120 million for wide-ranging student lending failures.】

item.title: 英国挑战者银行受资本规则改革提振
item.description: 修订后的英国银行资本规则为努力从英国最大银行手中抢夺市场份额的小型贷款机构提供了救命稻草，增加了它们在 1.7 万亿英镑（2.22 万亿美元）抵押贷款市场上提供更具竞争力利率的机会。【原文：Revised UK bank capital rules have thrown a lifeline to smaller lenders struggling to poach market share from Britain's biggest banks, boosting their chances of offering more competitive rates in the 1.7 trillion pound ($2.22 trillion) mortgage market.】

item.title: Downdetector 显示数千用户的 Microsoft 365 出现故障
item.description: 根据故障跟踪网站 Downdetector.com 的数据，周四有数千名用户的微软生产力软件套件出现故障。【原文：Microsoft's suite of productivity software was down for thousands of users on Thursday, according to outage tracking website Downdetector.com.】

item.title: 美国财政部制定对最大、最赚钱公司征收 15%最低税的规则
item.description: 美国财政部周四公布了新的企业替代性最低税率的拟议规则，预计该税率将在 10 年内为约 100 家平均税率仅为 2.6% 的大公司带来 2,500 亿美元的收入。【原文：The U.S. Treasury on Thursday announced new proposed rules for a new corporate alternative minimum tax that is expected to generate $250 billion in U.S. revenues over 10 years from about 100 large companies now paying an average rate of just 2.6%.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数温和上升
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济金的美国人数量略有增加，表明即使劳动力市场放缓，裁员人数仍处于较低水平。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits increased marginally last week, pointing to a still-low level of layoffs even as the labor market slows.】

item.title: VIEW 欧洲央行年内第二次降息
item.description: 随着通胀放缓和经济增长乏力，欧洲中央银行周四再次降息，但几乎没有提供下一步行动的任何线索，即使投资者押注未来几个月将稳步放宽政策。【原文：The European Central Bank cut interest rates again on Thursday as inflation slows and economic growth falters, but provided almost no clues about its next step, even as investors bet on steady policy easing in the months ahead.】

item.title: 淡水河谷认为到 2030 年其铁矿石产量的 10%将来自尾矿
item.description: 巴西矿业公司淡水河谷的一位高管告诉路透社，预计到 2030 年，该公司约 10% 的铁矿石产量将来自被称为 "尾矿 "的矿山废料的再利用，从而减少仍储存在大坝中的潜在危险材料的数量。【原文：Brazilian miner Vale expects that by 2030 some 10% of its iron ore output will come from the reuse of mine waste known as tailings, an executive told Reuters, reducing the amount of potentially dangerous material still stored in dams.】

item.title: 中国蚂蚁金服集团再融资 65 亿美元信贷额度
item.description: 阿里巴巴创始人马云支持的中国蚂蚁金服集团发言人周四表示，该公司正在对65亿美元的信贷额度进行再融资。【原文：China's Ant Group , backed by Alibaba founder Jack Ma, is refinancing a credit line of $6.5 billion, a company spokesperson said on Thursday.】

item.title: 福特专业汽车首席执行官泰德-坎尼斯退休
item.description: 福特汽车公司周四表示，其生产商用车的 Pro 部门首席执行官泰德-坎尼斯（Ted Cannis）将于本月底退休。【原文：Ford Motor said on Thursday Ted Cannis, CEO of its Pro unit, which makes commercial vehicles, would retire by the end of this month.】

item.title: 欧洲央行下调经济增长预期，但仍认为通胀率将在 2025 年底达到目标
item.description: 欧洲中央银行周四下调了 2024 年的经济增长预期，但仍认为到 2025 年底通胀率将大致达到 2% 的目标。【原文：The European Central Bank lowered its 2024 economic growth projection on Thursday but still sees inflation broadly in line with its 2% target by the end of 2025.】

item.title: 陶氏下调第三季度营收预期，原因是得克萨斯州工厂发生意外事件
item.description: 由于位于得克萨斯州的一家工厂发生了意外事件，美国化学品制造商陶氏公司周四下调了第三季度收入预期。【原文：U.S. chemicals maker Dow lowered its third-quarter revenue forecast on Thursday due to an unplanned event at one of its plants in Texas.】

item.title: 增长和通胀放缓，欧洲央行下调利率
item.description: 欧洲中央银行周四下调了利率，称较低的通胀和经济增长使其可以稍微松开刹车。【原文：The European Central Bank cut its interest rates on Thursday, saying lower inflation and economic growth were allowing it to take its foot off the brake slightly.】

item.title: 克罗格公司季度销售额超出预期
item.description: 克罗格公司（Kroger）周四的季度同店销售额超过了华尔街的预期，这是因为该公司努力以更低的价格提供新鲜的食品杂货，从而吸引了希望节省开支的顾客。【原文：Kroger beat Wall Street estimates for quarterly same-store sales on Thursday, as its efforts to offer freshly sourced groceries at lower prices helped pull in customers looking to save dollars.】

item.title: 美国官员将与顶级科技高管就推动人工智能发展举行会谈 -CNN
item.description: 据美国有线电视新闻网（CNN）援引一位知情人士的话报道，来自开放人工智能（Open AI）、谷歌（Google）和Anthropic公司的高管将于周四在白宫与美国高级官员会面，讨论为人工智能提供动力所需的能源资源和基础设施。【原文：Executives from Open AI, Google and Anthropic will meet with senior U.S. officials at the White House on Thursday to discuss the energy resources and infrastructure needed to power AI, CNN reported citing a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 由于需求不佳，Stellantis 暂停生产电动菲亚特 500
item.description: Stellantis 公司周四表示，由于需求低迷，该公司将暂停生产全电动菲亚特 500 小型汽车，为期四周。【原文：Stellantis said on Thursday it would suspend production of the fully electric Fiat 500 small car for four weeks due to sluggish demand.】

item.title: 万事达卡将以 26.5 亿美元收购威胁情报公司 Recorded Future
item.description: 万事达支付公司周四表示，已同意以 26.5 亿美元的价格从私募股权公司 Insight Partners 手中收购威胁情报公司 Recorded Future。【原文：Mastercard has agreed to buy threat intelligence company Recorded Future from private equity firm Insight Partners for $2.65 billion, the payments company said on Thursday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，中国警告汽车制造商海外建厂的风险
item.description: 两位知情人士称，中国商务部在最近的一次会议上警告中国的汽车制造商，在海外进行汽车相关投资存在风险，因为他们正在寻求全球扩张，以应对国内市场增长放缓。【原文：China's commerce ministry has warned the country's carmakers of the risks of making auto-related investments overseas at a recent meeting, said two people briefed about the matter, as they seek global expansion to counter slowing growth in their home market.】
